intro: Deyeuxia brachyathera, commonly known as the short-haired sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and cylindrical, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or moist habitats such as marshes, swamps, and along the edges of ponds. Its small, wind-pollinated flowers are usually green or brown, and it plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland ecosystems. Deyeuxia brachyathera is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-poor aquatic or semi-aquatic environments.
